definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
to apply (paint etc)/to smear/to daub/to blot out/to scribble/to scrawl/(literary) mud/street

sentences.english: His dotage simply made him more sadistic.
sentences.chinese: 再加上年老糊涂，他就更是个虐待狂了。

sentences.english: He is old and confused. I can not explain it clearly to him.
sentences.chinese: 跟他讲不清楚，他已经老糊涂了。

sentences.english: People who is old and muddle-headed.
sentences.chinese: 这么容易就忘了，真是一个老糊涂。

sentences.english: Dotard, a-dozing at the very nonce.
sentences.chinese: 老糊涂，恰恰在此刻打盹。

sentences.english: His dotage simply do he abundance sadistic.
sentences.chinese: 再加上年老糊涂，他就更是个狂了。

sentences.english: This Danny is only 40 years old, not as old and confused?
sentences.chinese: 这丹尼才40多岁，不至于老糊涂了吧？

sentences.english: You are a real dotard to have forgotten it so easily.
sentences.chinese: 这么容易就忘了，真是一个老糊涂。

sentences.english: I had forgotten. I do not believe admiration and wistful thoughts are against the societal norm.
sentences.chinese: 看来我是老糊涂了，我忘了赞美和向往也是犯罪。

definition: blurred vision of an old person (idiom)
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
(derog.) old but still alive/old fart/old bastard
variant of 老家伙[lao3 jia1 huo5]
even the wisest can have a momentary lapse in judgment (idiom)/every man has a fool in his sleeve
pinyin: cong1 ming5 yi1 shi4 , hu2 tu5 yi1 shi2

definition: unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
not knowing when to come or leave (idiom); with no sense of propriety
unfit for anything/no good/useless/(of a sick person) beyond hope
how can this be so? (idiom); preposterous/ridiculous/absurd
